page.title: 14HUNNINGTON and ROMSLEY
page.content: {Hunnington}Except for small estate for Bluebird workers built in '20s and for cottages and farms main population in large detached houses along main road. Both parishes in the green belt. {Romsley:}Between wars cheap land used to build small cottages.Most replaced by detached dwellings.In'50s estate was built over 3 fields,largely owner occupied but small council dev.Later a number of 2 storey flats built mainly for elderly. A pathway through estate follows the old right of way.. Few residents work in the parishes; most go by car to B'ham/ Black C'try. Mainly professional/semi-prof.;some council tenants work at Longbridge. Most fathers sole wage earner;some mothers part-time work clerical,farm or Bluebird:few farm workers.Farmers mainly middle aged with adult children assisting.Most adults new to area.
